title: Are Koreans descendants of Mongol and Chinese? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'd say Koreans are descendants of many different peoples throughout Asia, probably from the continent side… but, in modern Korea, there are more diverse people ethnically.

While there are Korean families that trace it’s roots to what is China today like Confucius’ descendants, there is little to no evidence to support a Chinese Korean theory. There are claims of Manchurians related with Koreans, though I haven’t seen any academic text about it.
The Indigenous Koreans and Mongolians are Dangun people or Dan’s Son meaning they descend from the Tribe of Dan and The Ainu are too aswell as some Tibetans.
